goals.question: What is the trend of electricity consumption in Iowa over the years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of electricity consumption over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is an increase or decrease in electricity consumption in Iowa over the years.

goals.question: What is the distribution of electricity prices in Iowa?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of electricity prices in Iowa and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between electricity consumption and prices in Iowa?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of electricity consumption and prices
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a relationship between electricity consumption and prices in Iowa.

goals.question: What is the distribution of renewable energy sources in Iowa?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of renewable energy sources
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proportion of renewable energy sources in Iowa's electricity generation.

goals.question: What is the trend of electricity generation from coal in Iowa?
goals.visualization: Line chart of electricity generation from coal over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a decrease in electricity generation from coal in Iowa over the years.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna()
    plt.plot(data['Year'], data['Consumption'])
    plt.title('What is the trend of electricity consumption in Iowa over the years?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('Electricity Consumption')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Price'] = pd.to_numeric(data['Price'], errors='coerce')
    plt.hist(data['Price'], bins=20, color='green', alpha=0.8)
    plt.axvline(data['Price'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Mean: {data['Price'].mean():0.2f}")
    plt.axvline(data['Price'].median(), color='blue', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['Price'].median():0.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of electricity prices in Iowa?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    plt.scatter(data['Price'], data['Consumption'])
    plt.xlabel('Price')
    plt.ylabel('Consumption')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between electricity consumption and prices in Iowa?')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('year').sum()
    data = data[['wind', 'hydro', 'solar', 'other_renewables']]
    ax = data.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True, figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.set_xlabel('Year')
    ax.set_ylabel('Renewable Energy Generation (Billion kWh)')
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of renewable energy sources in Iowa?')
    ax.legend(loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1.0, 1.0))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    data = data.sort_values(by='year')
    plt.plot(data['year'], data['net_generation_coal'], color='red')
    plt.title('What is the trend of electricity generation from coal in Iowa?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('Net Generation (Megawatthours)')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
